repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: This PR adds some additional support for using Python's limited API in more parts of Cython.

comment_data.body: Since this file is Cython the C macros aren't available to create compile-time decision-points. I assumed that they wouldn't be performance-critical and switched all macros over to use functions from the limited API instead. Let me know if you prefer a different approach.
Before reviewing this file I'd recommend looking at my changes and comment in ModuleSetupCode.c

I've basically copy-pasted equivalent macros throughout this PR at the moment because I wasn't sure what order different snippets would get included into the file to know which macros would be defined when. Ideally these kinds of macros could be centralized somewhere. Is this module the best place to put something like that? Could this be patched into another `#else` block of the `#if CYTHON_REFNANNY` if-else below?

I ask the same question about incref/decref below where it's much more important due to frequency of use, but asking here more generally: instead of having these conditionals everywhere would it make sense to define a common set of conditional macros somewhere that can be used throughout the code base and would be correctly selected for the limited API or not at compile time?

I'd use `__Pyx_PyList_SET_ITEM` which is a wrapper macro we've written in ModuleSetupCode.c (so it's always available - you can treat it as just coming from Python.h).

It also needs a signature change - return type is `int` and it has `except -1` exception specification.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,9 +57,9 @@ cdef extern from *:
         T& operator[](size_t)
 
 cdef extern from "Python.h":
-    void Py_INCREF(object)
+    void Py_IncRef(object)
     list PyList_New(Py_ssize_t size)
-    void PyList_SET_ITEM(object list, Py_ssize_t i, object o)
+    void PyList_SetItem(object list, Py_ssize_t i, object o)

comment_data.body:
Limited API sets `CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS` is `0` so this isn't needed.

We're generally trying not to use `CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API` and instead using things like `CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS` where we can.

```suggestion
            if (__Pyx_PyList_SET_ITEM(list, i, string) < 0) goto __pyx_err;
```

Using the wrapper macro, and adding an error check.
I've probably already answered this question above :)
Again, this shouldn't be needed because `CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API` turns off `CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -60,7 +60,7 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject* __Pyx_PyUnicode_FromString(const char*);
 #define __Pyx_PyStr_FromString        __Pyx_PyUnicode_FromString
 #define __Pyx_PyStr_FromStringAndSize __Pyx_PyUnicode_FromStringAndSize
 
-#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS
+#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API

comment_data.body: I'd just use the macros in ModuleSetupCode.c - they're available absolutely everywhere so you don't need specific macros here.
Not needed - `CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_SIZE` is implied by LIMITED_API
These will need some error checking I think

> Ideally these kinds of macros could be centralized somewhere. Is this module the best place to put something like that?

Yes - ModuleSetupCode.c contains the bit of utility code that's always included, and is where the centralized stuff goes.

As I said in another comment - if we change it then I think think we should change it absolutely everywhere at once (with a big find/replace).

The naming scheme for Cython helper macros is `__Pyx_something` so they should stick to that. e.g. `__Pyx_Py_INCREF`

~I think `__Pyx_INCREF()` is enough.~

EDIT: We already use that for the refnanny, and it seems that we must keep the two separate. Since we use the refnanny in most places, having a longer name for the non-refnanny cases seems better. In that light, `__Pyx_Py_INCREF()` is fine, since it at least suggests that it doesn't do more than `Py_INCREF()`.

However, having both seems generally confusing
Lacks error handling. I'd rather extract *only* the `char*` reading and keep everything else as before, and then only add error handling for this call in the Limited API case.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -11441,11 +11441,19 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
         ))
         code.put_gotref(shapes_temp, py_object_type)
 
+        code.putln("#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")
+        code.putln('%s = __pyx_array_new(%s, %s, PyBytes_AsString(%s), "%s", (char *) %s); %s' % (
